card.name: Ancestor's Chosen
card.ability:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
When Ancestor's Chosen enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each card in your graveyard.
card.flavor: Empowered by generations of strength.

card.name: Anger
card.ability:
Haste
As long as Anger is in your graveyard and you control a Mountain, creatures you control have haste.
card.flavor:
"For its time as a mortal, Anger chose a shell of boiling rock."
—Scroll of Beginnings
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The timestamp for the "in your graveyard" ability is set at the time that this card goes to your graveyard, regardless of whether you control a Mountain at that time.

card.name: Anurid Barkripper
card.ability: Threshold — Anurid Barkripper gets +2/+2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.flavor: When it croaks, so do you.

card.name: Anurid Brushhopper
card.ability: Discard two cards: Exile Anurid Brushhopper. Return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor: It's so tough it can frighten itself into hiding.

card.name: Anurid Swarmsnapper
card.ability:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
{1}{G}: Anurid Swarmsnapper can block an additional creature this turn.
card.flavor: Anurids have the problem of airborne invaders licked.

card.name: Arcane Teachings
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
card.flavor: Dwarves may teach at the speed of stone, but their results are solid.

card.name: Aven Fogbringer
card.ability:
Flying
When Aven Fogbringer enters the battlefield, return target land to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: "I cover the land with blankets and it sleeps."

card.name: Aven Warcraft
card.ability:
Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, choose a color. Creatures you control also gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn.

card.name: Balthor the Defiled
card.ability:
Minion creatures get +1/+1.
{B}{B}{B}, Exile Balthor the Defiled: Each player returns all black and all red creature cards from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor: He remembers enough of his life to weep for what he has lost.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The Legend rule only applies to two Legends with identical names. If the names are similar, but different, the rule does not apply.

card.name: Barbarian Bully
card.ability: Discard a card at random: Barbarian Bully gets +2/+2 until end of turn unless a player has Barbarian Bully deal 4 damage to him or her. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: "Out of my way"

card.name: Battle Screech
card.ability:
Put two 1/1 white Bird creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
Flashback—Tap three untapped white creatures you control. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Battlefield Scrounger
card.ability: Threshold — Put three cards from your graveyard on the bottom of your library: Battlefield Scrounger gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn, and only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Check the number of cards in your graveyard before activating the ability. If activating the ability causes that number to fall below seven, the ability still resolves as normal.

card.name: Battlewise Aven
card.ability:
Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Battlewise Aven gets +1/+1 and has first strike.
card.flavor: Experience is a good teacher, not a kind one.

card.name: Benevolent Bodyguard
card.ability: Sacrifice Benevolent Bodyguard: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: "My destiny is to save others so their destinies may be achieved."

card.name: Book Burning
card.ability: Any player may have Book Burning deal 6 damage to him or her. If no one does, target player puts the top six cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: The wizard's spellbook was full of burning questions.

card.name: Border Patrol
card.ability: Vigilance
card.flavor:
"We have been victims of treachery, of the Cabal, and of our own ambitions. No more."
—Commander Eesha

card.name: Brawn
card.ability:
Trample
As long as Brawn is in your graveyard and you control a Forest, creatures you control have trample.
card.flavor:
"‘I have arrived,' bellowed Brawn, and the plane shuddered."
—Scroll of Beginnings

card.name: Breaking Point
card.ability: Any player may have Breaking Point deal 6 damage to him or her. If no one does, destroy all creatures. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: "Enough"

card.name: Browbeat
card.ability: Any player may have Browbeat deal 5 damage to him or her. If no one does, target player draws three cards.
card.flavor:
"Even the threat of power has power."
—Jeska, warrior adept

card.name: Burning Wish
card.ability: You may choose a sorcery card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Burning Wish.
card.flavor: She wished for a weapon, but not for the skill to wield it.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Can't acquire the Ante cards. They are considered still "in the game" as are cards in the library and the graveyard.
5/1/2007 : The choice is optional.
5/1/2007 : If you fail to find something, you still exile this.
9/16/2007 : Can't acquire cards that are phased out.
10/1/2009 : You can't acquire exiled cards because those cards are still in one of the game's zones.
10/1/2009 : In a sanctioned event, a card that's "outside the game" is one that's in your sideboard. In an unsanctioned event, you may choose any card from your collection.

card.name: Cabal Therapy
card.ability:
Name a nonland card. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards with that name.
Flashback—Sacrifice a creature. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You name the card during resolution, then your opponent reveals their hand and discards if appropriate. There is no way for your opponent to do anything between you naming the card and them discarding.

card.name: Cabal Trainee
card.ability: Sacrifice Cabal Trainee: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Ah, a faceshredder. Very rare. Nearly unstoppable. Good luck"
—Cabal instructor

card.name: Cagemail
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't attack.
card.flavor:
"Power often costs too high a price."
—Commander Eesha

card.name: Canopy Claws
card.ability:
Target creature loses flying until end of turn.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Centaur Rootcaster
card.ability: Whenever Centaur Rootcaster deals combat damage to a player, you may search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. If you do, shuffle your library.

card.name: Cephalid Constable
card.ability: Whenever Cephalid Constable deals combat damage to a player, return up to that many target permanents that player controls to their owners' hands.
card.flavor: Cephalids don't police people. They police loyalties.

card.name: Cephalid Inkshrouder
card.ability: Discard a card: Cephalid Inkshrouder gains shroud until end of turn and is unblockable this turn. (A permanent with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor: Cephalids shrink from the harsh glare of scrutiny.

card.name: Chastise
card.ability: Destroy target attacking creature. You gain life equal to its power.
card.flavor:
"Why do we pray to the Ancestor? Because She listens."
—Mystic elder

card.name: Commander Eesha
card.ability: Flying, protection from creatures
card.flavor: "War glides on the simplest updrafts while peace struggles against hurricane winds. It is the way of the world. It must change."

card.name: Crush of Wurms
card.ability:
Put three 6/6 green Wurm creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Flashback {9}{G}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Cunning Wish
card.ability: You may choose an instant card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Cunning Wish.
card.flavor: He wished for knowledge, but not for the will to apply it.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Can't acquire the Ante cards. They are considered still "in the game" as are cards in the library and the graveyard.
5/1/2007 : The choice is optional.
5/1/2007 : If you fail to find something, you still exile this.
9/16/2007 : Can't acquire cards that are phased out.
10/1/2009 : You can't acquire exiled cards because those cards are still in one of the game's zones.
10/1/2009 : In a sanctioned event, a card that's "outside the game" is one that's in your sideboard. In an unsanctioned event, you may choose any card from your collection.

card.name: Death Wish
card.ability: You may choose a card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand. You lose half your life, rounded up. Exile Death Wish.
card.flavor: He wished for power, but not for the longevity to abuse it.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Can't acquire the Ante cards. They are considered still "in the game" as are cards in the library and the graveyard.
5/1/2007 : The choice is optional.
5/1/2007 : If you fail to find something, you still exile this.
5/1/2007 : If you fail to find something, you still lose half your life, rounded up.
9/16/2007 : Can't acquire cards that are phased out.
10/1/2009 : You can't acquire exiled cards because those cards are still in one of the game's zones.
10/1/2009 : In a sanctioned event, a card that's "outside the game" is one that's in your sideboard. In an unsanctioned event, you may choose any card from your collection.

card.name: Defy Gravity
card.ability:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Flashback {U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Magical or not, it's still a cloud.

card.name: Dwarven Bloodboiler
card.ability: Tap an untapped Dwarf you control: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: His battle cry unleashes an avalanche of dwarves.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability can be activated the turn it enters the battlefield because the ability does not use the {Tap} symbol.
10/4/2004 : Yes, it can tap itself.

card.name: Dwarven Driller
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target land unless its controller has Dwarven Driller deal 2 damage to him or her.
card.flavor:
"Drill the planet, it's no trouble:
Mining granite, making rubble."
—Dwarven drilling song

card.name: Dwarven Scorcher
card.ability: Sacrifice Dwarven Scorcher: Dwarven Scorcher deals 1 damage to target creature unless that creature's controller has Dwarven Scorcher deal 2 damage to him or her.
card.flavor: Barbarians invented the blaze of glory. Dwarves perfected it.

card.name: Earsplitting Rats
card.ability:
When Earsplitting Rats enters the battlefield, each player discards a card.
Discard a card: Regenerate Earsplitting Rats.
card.flavor: Rats come in one amount: too many.

card.name: Elephant Guide
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature dies, put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Nature's strength outlives the strong.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If cast targeting an opponent's creature, you get the Elephant when that creature goes to the graveyard.

card.name: Ember Shot
card.ability:
Ember Shot deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: Dwarves bring poor coal to market, use good coal in their homes, and throw their best coal away.

card.name: Envelop
card.ability: Counter target sorcery spell.
card.flavor:
"What you made will be unmade. What you learned will be unlearned. And when you're done, you will be undone."
—Ambassador Laquatus

card.name: Epic Struggle
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control twenty or more creatures, you win the game.
card.flavor:
"If our foes will not listen to words, perhaps hooves and claws will make them take notice."
—Seton, centaur druid
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : To win, you must control 20 or more creatures both at the beginning of upkeep and when it resolves.

card.name: Erhnam Djinn
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, target non-Wall creature an opponent controls gains forestwalk until your next upkeep.
card.flavor: He provides a safe path to nowhere.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : In multiplayer games you can choose a different player's creature each upkeep. You are forced to pick a creature that some opponent controls if there is at least one creature on the battlefield that is a legal target.
10/4/2004 : If you have more than one Djinn, you can have all of them target the same creature with their ability.
10/4/2004 : If there are no creatures your opponent controls to target at the beginning of your upkeep, ignore this ability.

card.name: Exoskeletal Armor
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+X, where X is the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
card.flavor:
"We use only what we need—but in times of strife, our need becomes great."
—Centaur warrior
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The value of X changes as the number of creatures cards in graveyards changes.

card.name: Filth
card.ability:
Swampwalk
As long as Filth is in your graveyard and you control a Swamp, creatures you control have swampwalk.
card.flavor:
"As the portal closed, Filth oozed through. The stench of evil followed it in."
—Scroll of Beginnings

card.name: Firecat Blitz
card.ability:
Put X 1/1 red Elemental Cat creature tokens with haste onto the battlefield. Exile them at the beginning of the next end step.
Flashback—{R}{R}, Sacrifice X Mountains. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Flaring Pain
card.ability:
Damage can't be prevented this turn.
Flashback {R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor:
"I don't rub salt in wounds. I use sulfur."
—Matoc, lavamancer
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Spells and abilities that replace or redirect damage are not affected by this card.
10/4/2004 : The "damage can't be prevented" statement overrides all forms of preventing damage. Damage prevention spells and abilities can still be cast and activated, they just don't do anything.

card.name: Flash of Insight
card.ability:
Look at the top X cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
Flashback—{1}{U}, Exile X blue cards from your graveyard. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost, then exile it. You can't exile Flash of Insight to pay for its own flashback cost.)

card.name: Fledgling Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Fledgling Dragon gets +3/+3 and has "{R}: Fledgling Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn."

card.name: Folk Medicine
card.ability:
You gain 1 life for each creature you control.
Flashback {1}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Sometimes the healers need healing.

card.name: Forcemage Advocate
card.ability: {T}: Return target card from an opponent's graveyard to his or her hand. Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
card.flavor: "Our unity renews our strength."

card.name: Funeral Pyre
card.ability: Exile target card from a graveyard. Its owner puts a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"Raze the body. Raise the soul."
—Mystic elder

card.name: Genesis
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Genesis is in your graveyard, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor:
"First through the Riftstone was Genesis—and the world was lifeless no more."
—Scroll of Beginnings

card.name: Giant Warthog
card.ability: Trample
card.flavor:
"When the Ancestor saw the cruelty her human children were capable of, Her fury shook the world. From this outburst sprang the warthogs."
—Nomad myth

card.name: Glory
card.ability:
Flying
{2}{W}: Choose a color. Creatures you control gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn. Activate this ability only if Glory is in your graveyard.
card.flavor:
"Glory was gone; Glory was everywhere."
—Scroll of Beginnings

card.name: Golden Wish
card.ability: You may choose an artifact or enchantment card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Golden Wish.
card.flavor: She wished for nobility, but not for a nation to honor it.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Can't acquire the Ante cards. They are considered still "in the game" as are cards in the library and the graveyard.
9/16/2007 : Can't acquire cards that are phased out.
10/1/2009 : You can't acquire exiled cards because those cards are still in one of the game's zones.
10/1/2009 : In a sanctioned event, a card that's "outside the game" is one that's in your sideboard. In an unsanctioned event, you may choose any card from your collection.

card.name: Goretusk Firebeast
card.ability: When Goretusk Firebeast enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to target player.
card.flavor: As a youth, Kamahl took one for a pet. His hair has yet to grow back.

card.name: Grave Consequences
card.ability:
Each player may exile any number of cards from his or her graveyard. Then each player loses 1 life for each card in his or her graveyard.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"You call that a nightmare?"
—Braids, dementia summoner

card.name: Grip of Amnesia
card.ability:
Counter target spell unless its controller exiles all cards from his or her graveyard.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Would you abandon your past to save your future?"
—Ambassador Laquatus
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can choose to exile all cards from your graveyard even if it has no cards in it.

card.name: Grizzly Fate
card.ability:
Put two 2/2 green Bear creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Threshold — Put four 2/2 green Bear creature tokens onto the battlefield instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
Flashback {5}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : At the time this spell is resolving, it is on the stack and not in the graveyard. This means that you should not count this card when determining whether the Threshold effect occurs.

card.name: Guided Strike
card.ability:
Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"May the Ancestor strengthen my hand and guide my blade."
—Nomad war prayer

card.name: Guiltfeeder
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever Guiltfeeder attacks and isn't blocked, defending player loses 1 life for each card in his or her graveyard.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Hapless Researcher
card.ability: Sacrifice Hapless Researcher: Draw a card, then discard a card.
card.flavor: Scholars possess such lofty knowledge that it shouldn't be surprising when they fall.

card.name: Harvester Druid
card.ability: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land you control could produce.
card.flavor: "In the end, the same soil lies atop the field, within the mountain, and under the sea."

card.name: Hunting Grounds
card.ability: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Hunting Grounds has "Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield."
card.flavor: In the heavy hush of Krosa, drawing on mana is like ringing a dinner bell.

card.name: Infectious Rage
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-1.
When enchanted creature dies, choose a creature at random Infectious Rage can enchant. Return Infectious Rage to the battlefield attached to that creature.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : When this card returns to the battlefield, it is put onto the battlefield on the creature without targeting it, so it can be placed on a creature with Shroud.
10/4/2004 : You can't return this card to the battlefield onto something it can't enchant. For example, you can't place this card on a permanent with protection from red.

card.name: Ironshell Beetle
card.ability: When Ironshell Beetle enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
card.flavor:
"Why waste time creating weapons? Nature provides us with all we need."
—Centaur warrior

card.name: Jeska, Warrior Adept
card.ability:
First strike, haste
{T}: Jeska, Warrior Adept deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: "My brother and I both come from Balthor's forge. Kamahl has a temper of fire. I have a temper of steel."

card.name: Keep Watch
card.ability: Draw a card for each attacking creature.
card.flavor: "I see their moral dilemmas. I see their raw courage. I see their self-sacrifice. I see our victory."

card.name: Krosan Reclamation
card.ability:
Target player shuffles up to two target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.
Flashback {1}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Krosan Verge
card.ability:
Krosan Verge enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Krosan Verge: Search your library for a Forest card and a Plains card and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

card.name: Krosan Wayfarer
card.ability: Sacrifice Krosan Wayfarer: You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"The Krosan Forest lives, and druids are its seeds."
—Seton, centaur druid
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional.  When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

card.name: Laquatus's Disdain
card.ability:
Counter target spell cast from a graveyard.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: "The first time was amusing, but now you're getting tiresome."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can be used to counter a spell cast using the Flashback ability, or cast from the graveyard using any other effect.

card.name: Lava Dart
card.ability:
Lava Dart deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Flashback—Sacrifice a Mountain. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Lead Astray
card.ability: Tap up to two target creatures.
card.flavor:
"Never underestimate our enemy's strength, brutality, . . . or stupidity."
—Commander Eesha

card.name: Liberated Dwarf
card.ability: {R}, Sacrifice Liberated Dwarf: Target green creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor: Freed from their chains, these dwarves are bound only by honor.

card.name: Lightning Surge
card.ability:
Lightning Surge deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, instead Lightning Surge deals 6 damage to that creature or player and the damage can't be prevented.
Flashback {5}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It either deals 4 damage or 6 damage. It does not deal 10 damage.
4/15/2013 : At the time this spell is resolving, it is on the stack and not in the graveyard. This means that you should not count this card when determining whether the Threshold effect occurs.

card.name: Living Wish
card.ability: You may choose a creature or land card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Living Wish.
card.flavor: He wished for growth, but not for a way to control it.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Can't acquire the Ante cards. They are considered still "in the game" as are cards in the library and the graveyard.
5/1/2007 : The choice is optional.
5/1/2007 : If you fail to find something, you still exile this.
9/16/2007 : Can't acquire cards that are phased out.
10/1/2009 : You can't acquire exiled cards because those cards are still in one of the game's zones.
10/1/2009 : In a sanctioned event, a card that's "outside the game" is one that's in your sideboard. In an unsanctioned event, you may choose any card from your collection.

card.name: Lost in Thought
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated. Its controller may exile three cards from his or her graveyard for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can take the "exile three cards" action any time you have priority without using the stack.

card.name: Masked Gorgon
card.ability:
Green creatures and white creatures have protection from Gorgons.
Threshold — Masked Gorgon has protection from green and from white as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

card.name: Mental Note
card.ability:
Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: Some minds are more open than others.

card.name: Mirari's Wake
card.ability:
Creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana to your mana pool of any type that land produced.
card.flavor: The land drank power from the Mirari as though it had thirsted forever.

card.name: Mirror Wall
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{W}: Mirror Wall can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.
card.flavor:
"Breaking it would be about four hundred years bad luck."
—Nomad sentry

card.name: Mist of Stagnation
card.ability:
Permanents don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses a permanent for each card in his or her graveyard, then untaps those permanents.

card.name: Morality Shift
card.ability: Exchange your graveyard and library. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: The mind sings, though at times it sings a dirge.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This spell does work if either your graveyard or library is empty.
10/4/2004 : You can choose the order of the cards being placed into the graveyard.

card.name: Nantuko Monastery
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
Threshold — {G}{W}: Nantuko Monastery becomes a 4/4 green and white Insect Monk creature with first strike until end of turn. It's still a land. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.
10/1/2009 : The layering rules have changed. Now if you animate a land and its power and toughness are lowered by Mutilate or a similar effect, reactivating the land's ability won't reset the values. This is because you apply all effects that set power and toughness to specific values before you apply any that modify power and toughness, regardless of the order in which the effects resolve.

card.name: Nantuko Tracer
card.ability: When Nantuko Tracer enters the battlefield, you may put target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.
card.flavor:
Your past is a map to where you will go.
—Nantuko teaching

card.name: Nomad Mythmaker
card.ability: {W}, {T}: Put target Aura card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control attached to a creature you control.
card.flavor: Nomads weave tales thicker than tapestries.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You don't choose which creature the Aura will enter the battlefield attached to until the ability resolves. You must choose a creature the Aura can legally enchant. (For example, you can't choose a creature with protection from black if the targeted Aura card is black.) If you don't control any creatures that the Aura can enchant, it remains in the graveyard.
7/15/2007 : Nomad Mythmaker's ability can target an Aura card in any graveyard, not just yours.

card.name: Nullmage Advocate
card.ability: {T}: Return two target cards from an opponent's graveyard to his or her hand. Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: "Our unity unmasks your deceit."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can't activate this ability unless a single opponent has at least two cards in their graveyard to target.

card.name: Phantom Centaur
card.ability:
Protection from black
Phantom Centaur enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Centaur, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Centaur.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If this card is going to take damage from a black source, you can choose to apply Protection from Black's damage prevention ability prior to applying this card's built-in ability. This means you don't have to remove a counter.
10/4/2004 : If this card takes damage from multiple sources at once (for example if it is blocked by multiple creatures in combat), it only loses one counter.
10/4/2004 : If unpreventable damage is applied to this card, you still remove a counter even though the prevention fails.
10/4/2004 : Remove one counter each time it would be damaged. If it was going to take more than one point of damage, you prevent all the damage and still only remove one counter.
10/4/2004 : The damage prevention ability works even if it has no counters, as long as some effect keeps its toughness above zero.

card.name: Phantom Flock
card.ability:
Flying
Phantom Flock enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Flock, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Flock.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If this card takes damage from multiple sources at once (for example if it is blocked by multiple creatures in combat), it only loses one counter.
10/4/2004 : If unpreventable damage is applied to this card, you still remove a counter even though the prevention fails.
10/4/2004 : Remove one counter each time it would be damaged. If it was going to take more than one point of damage, you prevent all the damage and still only remove one counter.
10/4/2004 : The damage prevention ability works even if it has no counters, as long as some effect keeps its toughness above zero.

card.name: Phantom Nantuko
card.ability:
Trample
Phantom Nantuko enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Nantuko, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Nantuko.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Phantom Nantuko.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If this card takes damage from multiple sources at once (for example if it is blocked by multiple creatures in combat), it only loses one counter.
10/4/2004 : If unpreventable damage is applied to this card, you still remove a counter even though the prevention fails.
10/4/2004 : Remove one counter each time it would be damaged. If it was going to take more than one point of damage, you prevent all the damage and still only remove one counter.
10/4/2004 : The damage prevention ability works even if it has no counters, as long as some effect keeps its toughness above zero.

card.name: Phantom Nishoba
card.ability:
Trample
Phantom Nishoba enters the battlefield with seven +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever Phantom Nishoba deals damage, you gain that much life.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Nishoba, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Nishoba.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If this card takes damage from multiple sources at once (for example if it is blocked by multiple creatures in combat), it only loses one counter.
10/4/2004 : If unpreventable damage is applied to this card, you still remove a counter even though the prevention fails.
10/4/2004 : Remove one counter each time it would be damaged. If it was going to take more than one point of damage, you prevent all the damage and still only remove one counter.
10/4/2004 : The damage prevention ability works even if it has no counters, as long as some effect keeps its toughness above zero.

card.name: Phantom Nomad
card.ability:
Phantom Nomad enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Nomad, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Nomad.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If this card takes damage from multiple sources at once (for example if it is blocked by multiple creatures in combat), it only loses one counter.
10/4/2004 : If unpreventable damage is applied to this card, you still remove a counter even though the prevention fails.
10/4/2004 : Remove one counter each time it would be damaged. If it was going to take more than one point of damage, you prevent all the damage and still only remove one counter.
10/4/2004 : The damage prevention ability works even if it has no counters, as long as some effect keeps its toughness above zero.

card.name: Phantom Tiger
card.ability:
Phantom Tiger enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Tiger, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Tiger.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If this card takes damage from multiple sources at once (for example if it is blocked by multiple creatures in combat), it only loses one counter.
10/4/2004 : If unpreventable damage is applied to this card, you still remove a counter even though the prevention fails.
10/4/2004 : Remove one counter each time it would be damaged. If it was going to take more than one point of damage, you prevent all the damage and still only remove one counter.
10/4/2004 : The damage prevention ability works even if it has no counters, as long as some effect keeps its toughness above zero.

card.name: Planar Chaos
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, sacrifice Planar Chaos.
Whenever a player casts a spell, that player flips a coin. If he or she loses the flip, counter that spell.

card.name: Prismatic Strands
card.ability:
Prevent all damage that sources of the color of your choice would deal this turn.
Flashback—Tap an untapped white creature you control. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Pulsemage Advocate
card.ability: {T}: Return three target cards from an opponent's graveyard to his or her hand. Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor: "Our unity revives our hopes."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can't activate this ability unless a single opponent has at least three cards in his or her graveyard to target and you have a creature card in your graveyard to target.

card.name: Quiet Speculation
card.ability: Search target player's library for up to three cards with flashback and put them into that player's graveyard. Then the player shuffles his or her library.
card.flavor:
"The best foresight is hindsight."
—Empress Llawan
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can choose not to find all the cards if you don't want to.

card.name: Rats' Feast
card.ability: Exile X target cards from a single graveyard.
card.flavor:
"That does it—I quit"
—Cabal grave robber

card.name: Ray of Revelation
card.ability:
Destroy target enchantment.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Webs of illusion unravel in the light of truth.

card.name: Riftstone Portal
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
As long as Riftstone Portal is in your graveyard, lands you control have "{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool."

card.name: Scalpelexis
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Scalpelexis deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top four cards of his or her library. If two or more of those cards have the same name, repeat this process.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The "repeat this process" means to repeat as often as it takes to not get a matching pair.

card.name: Seedtime
card.ability:
Cast Seedtime only during your turn.
Take an extra turn after this one if an opponent cast a blue spell this turn.
card.flavor:
The hippo grows wings to fight the condor.
—Nantuko teaching
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You only get an extra turn if an opponent cast a blue spell this turn prior to this spell resolving. Note that "casting" a spell only requires it to be announced, so an unresolved spell still counts as having been cast.

card.name: Selfless Exorcist
card.ability: {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. That card deals damage equal to its power to Selfless Exorcist.

card.name: Serene Sunset
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage X target creatures would deal this turn.
card.flavor: The armies paused, silent, as the warriors reflected on the sunsets of their youth.

card.name: Shaman's Trance
card.ability: Until end of turn, other players can't play cards from their graveyards, and you may play cards from other players' graveyards as though they were in your graveyard.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This card does not allow you to activate the abilities of cards in other people's graveyards.
10/4/2004 : You can use Flashback on cards to cast them.

card.name: Shieldmage Advocate
card.ability: {T}: Return target card from an opponent's graveyard to his or her hand. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn by a source of your choice.
card.flavor: "Our unity conquers all fears."

card.name: Silver Seraph
card.ability:
Flying
Threshold — Other creatures you control get +2/+2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.flavor: A symbol of hope for hopeless times.

card.name: Solitary Confinement
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Solitary Confinement unless you discard a card.
Skip your draw step.
You have shroud. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you.

card.name: Soulcatchers' Aerie
card.ability:
Whenever a Bird is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, put a feather counter on Soulcatchers' Aerie.
Bird creatures get +1/+1 for each feather counter on Soulcatchers' Aerie.

card.name: Soulgorger Orgg
card.ability:
Trample
When Soulgorger Orgg enters the battlefield, you lose all but 1 life.
When Soulgorger Orgg leaves the battlefield, you gain life equal to the life you lost when it entered the battlefield.

card.name: Spellgorger Barbarian
card.ability:
When Spellgorger Barbarian enters the battlefield, discard a card at random.
When Spellgorger Barbarian leaves the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor: The epidemic insanity had a lasting effect on certain barbarians—but no one noticed.

card.name: Spelljack
card.ability: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard. You may play it without paying its mana cost for as long as it remains exiled. (If it has X in its mana cost, X is 0.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you cast an Instant or Sorcery, it goes to its owner's graveyard when it resolves.
10/4/2004 : This spell can be used on a spell cast using Flashback.
8/1/2008 : If you use this on an opponent's spell which has Buyback, you may pay the Buyback cost as you cast it. If you do so, the card will go to its owner's hand upon resolution. It will not go to your hand, nor to any player's graveyard.

card.name: Spirit Cairn
card.ability: Whenever a player discards a card, you may pay {W}. If you do, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: It marks the border between here and hereafter.

card.name: Spurnmage Advocate
card.ability: {T}: Return two target cards from an opponent's graveyard to his or her hand. Destroy target attacking creature.
card.flavor: "Our unity humbles our foes."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability is not countered if both cards are missing from the graveyard on resolution and the creature target is there. This makes it possible to have two Spurnmage Advocates both target the same two cards and end up destroying two creatures.
10/4/2004 : You can't activate this ability unless a single opponent has at least two cards in their graveyard to target.

card.name: Stitch Together
card.ability:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Threshold — Return that card from your graveyard to the battlefield instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Checks the number of cards in your graveyard when it starts resolving. You may drop below seven cards during resolution, but that won't stop it from resolving.

card.name: Sudden Strength
card.ability:
Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: The Mirari's magic transformed the Krosan Forest—and its inhabitants.

card.name: Suntail Hawk
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor:
"Our forebears once flew like this—carefree, needing nothing but a warm nest and a full belly. Our intellect may be more burden than blessing."
—Commander Eesha

card.name: Sutured Ghoul
card.ability:
Trample
As Sutured Ghoul enters the battlefield, exile any number of creature cards from your graveyard.
Sutured Ghoul's power is equal to the total power of the exiled cards and its toughness is equal to their total toughness.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : If any of the creature cards you exile has a characteristic-defining ability that defines its power and/or toughness, that ability will apply. For example, if Dungrove Elder is exiled this way, its power and toughness while it's in exile are equal to the number of Forests you control, and Sutured Ghoul's power and toughness will change as the number of Forests you control changes. If the characteristic-defining ability can't be applied (for instance, it relies on a choice made as the card enters the battlefield), then use 0.
9/22/2011 : In zones other than the battlefield, Sutured Ghoul's power and toughness are each 0.
9/22/2011 : You can't have Sutured Ghoul exile itself, even if it's entering the battlefield from your graveyard.

card.name: Swelter
card.ability: Swelter deals 2 damage to each of two target creatures.
card.flavor: No circle has a beginning, but many have foreseeable ends.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can't cast this spell unless you have two different legal targets.

card.name: Swirling Sandstorm
card.ability: Threshold — Swirling Sandstorm deals 5 damage to each creature without flying if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.flavor: As dust swept out, vultures swept in.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This card does nothing if you don't have seven cards in your graveyard when it resolves.

card.name: Sylvan Safekeeper
card.ability: Sacrifice a land: Target creature you control gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor:
"How could someone so small cause so much trouble?"
—Nomad sentry

card.name: Telekinetic Bonds
card.ability: Whenever a player discards a card, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, you may tap or untap target permanent.
card.flavor:
"Nature's been fired. The oceans are under new management."
—Ambassador Laquatus

card.name: Test of Endurance
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 50 or more life, you win the game.
card.flavor:
"If we have learned nothing else, we have learned to survive."
—Mystic elder
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : To win the game, you must have 50 or more life both at the beginning of upkeep and when the ability resolves.

card.name: Thriss, Nantuko Primus
card.ability: {G}, {T}: Target creature gets +5/+5 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "When you live for others, you live for yourself."

card.name: Toxic Stench
card.ability:
Target nonblack creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, instead destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.

card.name: Trained Pronghorn
card.ability: Discard a card: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Trained Pronghorn this turn.
card.flavor:
"The desert asked the Ancestor for children, and the antelope were born."
—Nomad myth

card.name: Treacherous Vampire
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Treacherous Vampire attacks or blocks, sacrifice it unless you exile a card from your graveyard.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Treacherous Vampire gets +2/+2 and has "When Treacherous Vampire dies, you lose 6 life."

card.name: Treacherous Werewolf
card.ability: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Treacherous Werewolf gets +2/+2 and has "When Treacherous Werewolf dies, you lose 4 life."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The Threshold ability can't count this card (soon to be in the graveyard) when checking for Threshold.

card.name: Tunneler Wurm
card.ability: Discard a card: Regenerate Tunneler Wurm.
card.flavor: If an anurid's lucky, it'll find a warm tunnel for bedtime. If a wurm's lucky, it'll find a warm anurid for breakfast.

card.name: Unquestioned Authority
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When Unquestioned Authority enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has protection from creatures.
card.flavor:
"Only the Ancestor should be revered."
—Mystic heretic

card.name: Valor
card.ability:
First strike
As long as Valor is in your graveyard and you control a Plains, creatures you control have first strike.
card.flavor:
"The cracks widened, the shell crumbled, and Valor spread throughout the land."
—Scroll of Beginnings

card.name: Venomous Vines
card.ability: Destroy target enchanted permanent.
card.flavor:
"True strength comes from within. The false promise of unnatural power only incurs Krosa's wrath."
—Seton, centaur druid

card.name: Vigilant Sentry
card.ability: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Vigilant Sentry gets +1/+1 and has "{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn."

card.name: Web of Inertia
card.ability: At the beginning of each opponent's combat, that player may exile a card from his or her graveyard. If the player doesn't, creatures he or she controls can't attack you this turn.
card.flavor: Cephalids specialize in lose-lose situations.

card.name: Wonder
card.ability:
Flying
As long as Wonder is in your graveyard and you control an Island, creatures you control have flying.
card.flavor:
"The awestruck birds gazed at Wonder. Slowly, timidly, they rose into the air."
—Scroll of Beginnings

card.name: Worldgorger Dragon
card.ability:
Flying, trample
When Worldgorger Dragon enters the battlefield, exile all other permanents you control.
When Worldgorger Dragon leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to the battlefield under their owners' control.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It is possible for the Dragon to leave the battlefield before its "enters the battlefield" trigger resolves. If this happens, then the "leaves the battlefield" trigger will have nothing to return and the "enters the battlefield" trigger's effects will be irreversible.
8/1/2005 : If an Aura is exiled this way, you can place it on any legal permanent when it returns. It doesn't have to go back to the same place. It can't be placed on a permanent that is entering the battlefield at the same time.

card.name: Wormfang Behemoth
card.ability:
When Wormfang Behemoth enters the battlefield, exile all cards from your hand.
When Wormfang Behemoth leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to their owner's hand.

card.name: Wormfang Crab
card.ability:
Wormfang Crab is unblockable.
When Wormfang Crab enters the battlefield, an opponent chooses a permanent you control other than Wormfang Crab and exiles it.
When Wormfang Crab leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

card.name: Wormfang Drake
card.ability:
Flying
When Wormfang Drake enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile a creature you control other than Wormfang Drake.
When Wormfang Drake leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

card.name: Wormfang Manta
card.ability:
Flying
When Wormfang Manta enters the battlefield, you skip your next turn.
When Wormfang Manta leaves the battlefield, you take an extra turn after this one.

card.name: Wormfang Newt
card.ability:
When Wormfang Newt enters the battlefield, exile a land you control.
When Wormfang Newt leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
card.flavor: Spawned by mages emulating the insane.

card.name: Wormfang Turtle
card.ability:
When Wormfang Turtle enters the battlefield, exile a land you control.
When Wormfang Turtle leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
card.flavor: Chainer's admirers keep his dreams alive.
